page.title: 20RELIGION,SAUNDERSFOOT
page.content: The window was owned by Narberth Church but when it closed down it was brought to Saundersfoot.Local glassfitters would not tackle the job so experts from Swansea fitted it.The Wesley Chapel anticipates closing down in 1989 when the lease expires as it will be too expensive to renew. {The Congregational Chapel}in the High St.was built in 1899.There is no resident minister. {The Baptist Chapel}was first built in 1854,and rebuilt in 1881. {St.Brides Catholic Church}is a modern building constructed in the last 10 years.The clergy travel from Tenby to conduct services on Sundays and Holy Days. {Of six people interviewed in the {village,five of them attended a place {of worship regularly.}
